column1: Gameleira is a city in Pernambuco
column2: Brazil. The name Gameleira is derived from the large number of Gameleira trees (family Moraceae) that were growing in the region. The city is 99 km away from Recife
column3: the capital city of Pernambuco. Gameleira has a bus terminal
column5: two state schools and several municipal schools.

column1: The district of Gameleira was created by Provincial Law 763 (Lei Provincial n° 763)
column3: 1867.  It was then part of the municipality of Sirinhaém. In 1872
column4: it became a village (Lei Provincial n° 1.057).  In 1860
column5: the Recife–São Francisco Railroad established a station in Gameleira. Local sugarcane plantations used the railroad to transport sugar to the port in Recife.

column1: Boundaries - Ribeirão  (N);  Água Preta (S and W);   Rio Formoso and Ribeirão  (E)
The main economic activities in Gameleira are based in agribusiness
column2: especially plantation of sugarcane; and creations of cattle and buffalos.
